channel.title: Clicking an Item

item.title: Clicking an Item
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Use a void for the interface.

public void interfaceOne() { openUpInterface(#); sendQuest("", 0000); }

You may have a switch statement such as this one:

[code] public boolean CheckForSkillUse3(int Item, int Slot) {
boolean GoOn = true;

    switch (Item) {[/code]

case ITEMID: { interfaceOne(); } break;

Read full topic

item.title: Clicking an Item
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

				}
				if(itemID == 4597) {
				sendQuest("123", 8144);  
				break;
				}

This is what I currently have, I know it is most likely wrong, but I have never made anything like this before.

http://img685.imageshack.us/img685/2006/msh.png

I want to be able to click the object like in the picture, for example “Read” then have an interface pop up with a list for example pop up, but how would I do that?
